org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices

Class OpenGLMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.MatrixF
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.DenseMatrixF
        • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.ColumnMajorMatrixF
          • org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.matrices.OpenGLMatrix

  • public class OpenGLMatrix
extends ColumnMajorMatrixF
    An OpenGLMatrix is a 4x4 matrix commonly used as a transformation matrix for 3D homogeneous coordinates. The data layout of an OpenGLMatrix is used heavily in the OpenGL high performance graphics standard.
    See Also:
    Homogenous coordinates, Transformation Matrix, android.opengl.Matrix, Matrix

      • emptyMatrix

        public MatrixF emptyMatrix(int numRows,
                           int numCols)
        Description copied from class: MatrixF
        Returns a new empty matrix of the indicated dimensions. If a specific implementation associated with the receiver can be used with these dimensions, then such is used; otherwise a general matrix implementation will be used.
        Specified by:
        emptyMatrix in class MatrixF
        Returns:
        a new empty matrix of the indicated dimensions
